title: Simulation-Based Educational Module for Responsible Antimicrobial Use

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: An interactive learning environment using VR simulations and digital devices, where learners experience antimicrobial prescription decision-making processes based on real-world cases encountered in their work

learning_goals: Learners can analyze cases of antimicrobial misuse via VR simulations and accurately explain appropriate prescription criteria with over 80% accuracy.
Learners systematically perform the antibiotic selection process in four or more stages using a decision-making framework presented in a module applying Cognitive Load Theory.
Learners improve their antimicrobial-related knowledge test scores by over 30% in post-assessment compared to pre-assessment.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
